title: What to do when.......
body:
As a jungle main, I never know what to do when two or all lanes lose their match ups. Being in silver, I get all the blame of course, doesn't really affect me tho. But what should I do if all lanes lose and I am playing Lee Sin for example? HELP!

thanks

replies.body:
accept the loss and move on. if all 3 lanes lose with no jungle interference theres almost nothing you can do.

Maybe try to help the person with the best scaling, like an assassin or a tristana/kogmaw or something.

well what you do is tell them to stop humping the enemy tower and getting ganked all the time. also to stop pushing when they have no vision of river, there is no cure for bad team mates. one thing you can do is buy a pink ward and ward a stategic location so that they have vision and won't get ganked as much or use your trinket to ward for them. it's probably best not to gank a snowballing early game champ like {{champion:150}} {{champion:80}} {{champion:86}} just focus on securing objectives picking up kills amd farming.
Also, the crabs are up for grabs!

Depends on your jungler. If I'm playing full tank no damage Nunu i specifically concentrate on nothing but objectives. Keep wards up in between jungles and rivers. You do two things here. 1 you maintain complete dragon control and 2 your wards prevent (hopefully) enemy jungler doing his job, if team watches minimap. Best you can really do in that situation is find the lane that's pushed up the most and gank it. Coordinate with the laner. Again this all matters to what jungler you're playing and the enemy team comp.

I always found it best to baby sit the lane that is doing well and try to get them rolling and hopefully they can help carry. 

The other thing you can do is clean up or tax the losing lanes to try and transfer more gold on you who you know is doing well. (you will most likely get abused for this so be careful who you do it too)
